name: impenetrably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is impossible to see through or go through: He wore impenetrably dark wraparound sunglasses. The overgrown orchard was almost impenetrably jungle-like.
in a way that is impossible to understand: He writes impenetrably technical stories on nuclear topics. He found the company accounts were in good order and not impenetrably complex. See
impenetrable
More examplesFewer examplesThe drink he poured was a stout - an impenetrably black liquid. The fog was impenetrably dense.Their opinion is that the country is led by impenetrably smug upstarts who have little experience or wisdom.
